0.name: Consero.ps1
0.description: Unified web-based system integrating frontend UI, backend server, and AI-powered workflows for industrial automation.

1.name: Runtime Instantiation
1.description: Configuration for creating dynamic PSObject instances.

2.name: Dot Notation Support
2.description: Enable seamless access to object properties and functions via dot notation.

3.name: Parent-Child Linking
3.description: Automatically link parents and children to enable hierarchical traversal.

4.name: Dynamic Methods
4.description: Attach custom functions to PSObject instances for runtime flexibility.

5.name: Core Components
5.description: Essential features and functions of the application.

6.name: Hive Node Management
6.description: Registers nodes, monitors heartbeats, and enables load balancing.

7.name: Laptop Security
7.description: Enables devices to connect and function as hive nodes for distributed processing.

8.name: Debug Mode
8.description: Enables testing workflows and system integration.

9.name: Deployment Process
9.description: Single-file script deployable to any Windows system with PowerShell 5.1.

10.name: System Outputs
10.description: Includes marketingPlans, engagementStrategies, productCatalogs, customSolutions, and more.

11.name: Runtime Instance Generation
11.description: Generate PSObject instances with all relationships, dynamic methods, and runtime variables preconfigured.

12.name: Frontend UI
12.description: Single-page HTML, CSS, and JavaScript application served via PowerShell.

13.name: Backend Server
13.description: HTTP listener serving the UI and processing AI-powered workflows.

14.name: Email Server
14.description: Subsystem for handling email functionalities including migration, SMTP handling, and user authentication.

15.name: Email Migration
15.description: Functionality for migrating emails from GoDaddy to Microsoft 365, preserving historical data and ensuring minimal downtime.

16.name: SMTP Handling
16.description: Supports sending and receiving emails via SMTP protocol.

17.name: IMAP Support
17.description: Enables retrieval and synchronization of emails across devices.

18.name: General Variables
18.description: Shared variables like apiKey, outputFolder, serverPort, and debugMode.

19.name: Unique Variables
19.description: Custom variables like productPrompt, customerProfile, and solutionRequirements.

20.name: Unique Functions
20.description: Specialized functions for marketing, customer engagement, product catalog management, and custom solutions.

21.name: Utility Functions
21.description: Supportive functions like Invoke-OpenAI, GenerateReport, and SanitizeText.

22.name: Runtime Initialization Workflow
22.description: Configures runtime instance for PSObject creation and hierarchical traversal.

23.name: Dot Notation Workflow
23.description: Tests and validates seamless access to object properties and methods via dot notation.

24.name: Parent-Child Linking Workflow
24.description: Verifies recursive parent-child relationship traversal in PSObject hierarchy.

25.name: Dynamic Methods Workflow
25.description: Implements and validates dynamic method attachment to PSObject instances.

26.name: Hive Node Management Workflow
26.description: Tests node registration, heartbeat monitoring, and load balancing within the hive system.

27.name: Security Functionality Workflow
27.description: Validates secure laptop connections and hive node participation.

28.name: Debug Mode Workflow
28.description: Tests enabling and logging functionality in debug mode.

29.name: Deployment Workflow
29.description: Automates and validates single-file script deployment for PowerShell 5.1 systems.

30.name: Email Migration Workflow
30.description: Uses prompts to manage seamless email migration, handling user data and ensuring minimal downtime.

31.name: SMTP Handling Workflow
31.description: Develops workflows to configure SMTP settings and send emails programmatically.

32.name: IMAP Support Workflow
32.description: Handles email retrieval and synchronization prompts for IMAP support.

33.name: System Outputs Workflow
33.description: Ensures generated outputs like marketing plans, engagement strategies, and product catalogs meet defined specifications.

34.name: Frontend UI Workflow
34.description: Tests the rendering, interactivity, and integration of the frontend with the backend.

35.name: Backend Server Workflow
35.description: Tests HTTP listener operations, API communication, and concurrency handling.

36.name: Runtime Instance Generation Workflow
36.description: Verifies PSObject instantiation, relationship linking, and dynamic method attachment.

37.name: Cross-Component Meta-Workflow
37.description: Tests integration of FrontendUI, BackendServer, and EmailServer subsystems.

38.name: Hive Node Performance Workflow
38.description: Benchmarks node registration, heartbeat handling, and load balancing under high stress.

39.name: Email Migration Fallback Workflow
39.description: Validates fallback mechanisms during email migration for unanticipated errors.
